result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J Belongia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
(Apply 53 Days Credit)
HUBER, Standard Release Conditions
Court will allow early termination of probation after 6 month if requested by the Agent.

miscConds.notes: Apply cash bail. Refund balance to poster.

Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s,
No use or possession of illegal controlled substances ior drug paraphernalia.
Avoid any person or place associated with the sale, distribution, or use of illegal controlled substances.

Attend 1 Drug Treatment Court alumni meeting per month.
Comply with DTC aftercare program.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Dated 5/9/2018 from attorney Wolff advising of the credit owed to the defendant.

Defendant Ryan J Belongia in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has graduated from Drug Treatment Court. State files an amended information. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1 of the amended information. Count 2 remains dismissed and read in. Court finds defendant guilty of count 1. State makes recommendations. Atty. Wolff makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count 1

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

100 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - TBD).  STAYED..

Term of Probation: 1 Year (Possibility of Early Termination after 6 months at the request of the agent)

Conditions of Probation:

-Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

-Attend 1 DTC alumni meeting per months	

-Comply with DTC aftercare plan	

-Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

-No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;

-Defendant to avoid any person or place associated with the sale, distribution, or use of illegal controlled substances

COSTS:  $243.00 

DNA Surcharge: $200.00 

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
	
Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  Cash bail posted to be applied, remainder to be returned to poster.
